content: does the javascript ecosystem leave you
feeling like this maybe it's time for something new
redwood js redwood combines react with graphql
and prisma to make what we call an edge-ready framework for the jam stack
overwhelmed with webpack and babel configuration redwood's already taken
care of it everything talks to each other out of
the box and you can use our generators to write the boilerplate leaving you to
write the fun stuff feeling overwhelmed trying to learn yet
another javascript framework redwood has great documentation and an
award-winning friendly tutorial to walk you through just about everything you
can do with the framework tutorial has not actually won any awards
so don't wait download redwood the next 30 minutes and you'll receive hundreds
of npm packages absolutely free redwood is under very active development
it should not be considered ready for production environment side effects
redwood may include decreased stress increased job satisfaction and newfound
sense of purpose visit redwood.js.com for more information
so talk with your team today and find out if redwood's right for your next app
redwood it's not just a big tree it's your new favorite javascript framework
it started with a question can the jam stack be full stack
in march we gave our answer yes we gave you integrated react
graphql and prisma then we added built-in authentication
then testing with jest and integrated storybook
complete with data mocks typescript windows support diagnostics data
migrations role-based access control other
deployment targets more auth providers apollo 3
120 contributors 4 600 github stars what do we want to add
next you i'm tom preston warner
welcome to the future of redwood js you
